diagrams.title: CI Pipeline

threats.title: Developer commits secret to Gits
threats.description: Accidently a developer can commit the secret to CI pipe line which can be viewed by other co worker, and if any insider want to make a threat to the organization, can easily use to access the restricted data.
threats.mitigation:
It can be mitigated by applying Role Based Access to the user, or using least privilege mode for the user.
Continuous Log monitoring helps in preventing any un authorized access to the code.

threats.title: Git Push should be manage by only authoriZed person
threats.description: Any change in ci Pipeline should not push before checking it.
threats.mitigation:
Every change in the code is not necessarily need to push, it should be properly verified and checked before push. 
No unauthorized user should have permission to push the code in the repository, they can attempt to temper the code without knowledge to the authorized user.
Continuous monitoring and screen saver locks are always a good option to avoid those circumstances.

threats.title: Use of third party package can be risky to the business, a malicious actor can use that package.
threats.description:
If the developer added that third party software package according to the need of the software development in the CI Pipeline. The malicious actor can access to the code and use that package as a backdoor option to malign the code or reveal the data. 
The risk score is rated 8.5 and it is critical to the software development stage if properly not address before adding in the code.
threats.mitigation:
Some times Third party packages are actually needed to complete that code. The major area is to consider risk rate associated before adding in the CI Pipeline.
Software package sanitization is the best option before applying to the code, Checking of the certificate and terms and conditions can also help in estimating the package sanity.
All merge request should be reviewed by other co engineer too.
Only trusted companies package usage should be the policy of the company.

threats.title: Code Environment vulnerability
threats.description: If the code environment is deliberately written with wrong codes it can be vulnerable to attack.
threats.mitigation:
Code environment must be checked and reviewed by another system engineer, and code problems should be identified before pushing to CI/CD Pipeline.
Tempering attempt can be made by the adversary by using the vulnerable code structure. It is the best option to check the code with some tools to identify any vulnerability in the code, and after any attempt in changing the code it will also help the security team.

threats.title: Deploy stage might get repudiation Attack
threats.description: There is always a threat that if the user has got hacked , can be victim of phishing attack. Adversary can take the advantage and manipulate the data using user or admin in the deployment of the CI pipeline, causing repudiation attack to the integrity of the user. User did not about the act, and claim innocent.
threats.mitigation:
To mitigate this issue, logging on server is highly recommended. It will provide the timestamp, logging behavior of the current user, system log, application log and shell log provide alerts in case of any malicious activity.
Cloud environment log should also maintained by the security operator. It is an important aspect to find any random nature of attack from the attacker.
Secrets should be placed in the vault to protect from stolen. It is a safe way to protect the code in CI pipeline.
consider should be given to any unattended account and old account , and it should be blocked or disconnected from the server to enhance the security parameters.
Performing log analysis on continuous basis will also helpful in finding unusual behavior of users, attacker, and Ip addresses.

threats.title: use of opensource and widely used popular dependencies which are compromised later on.
threats.description: A malicious actor attack that dependency, it can be utilized by the code system without assuming susceptible to the developer. All the relevant code structure is compromised and become a risk to the business using that code.
threats.mitigation:
Continuous checks and information about the dependency is a helpful to provide timely mitigation.
use of security feature like lock dependency used version in the build, so only that dependency can used by the build every time in the CI pipeline.

diagrams.description: CI pipe line for DevSecOps lab
